nodes.bodyText:
should these (and the other icon-grey) not be changed to the sprites (was it different from not-built?)?
(not sure what the green ones above where ever for)
possibly although they aren't used in build status and that was the main goal of this PR, (and then to incrementally follow up once this is in)
unlear to me why these are removed, yet they where replaced in https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/pull/5065/files#diff-f58b5cf9ae51828d19d0b7d299430741ba3ee9d4679d6213da61aaea0b3d1540L592-R563
the svg ones will just be used always now instead of the combination of gif and png if I understand correctly
Before, there were 2 versions of each icon, png and gif. With SVG this doesn't make sense anymore, 1 version is enough.

We should acknowledge the source https://github.com/jenkins-contrib-themes/jenkins-core-theme/tree/master/images here; it's MIT licensed according to a metadata file. Not a lawyer but IIUC, while we can freely use it, we need to acknowledge where it's from and the license we're using it under. This also needs adding to jenkins/core/src/main/resources/hudson/AboutJenkins/index.jelly Lines 49 to 53 in b350b10

${%static.dependencies}

  • Font Awesome, created by Dave Gandy. SIL OFL 1.1 License and MIT License
  • Google Fonts: Roboto, created by Christian Robertson. Apache License, version 2.0
